abstract: Exxon’s earnings were a bit lower than analysts had expected despite strong revenue growth, reflecting a record $10.3 billion in capital and exploration expenditures.
snippet: Exxon’s earnings were a bit lower than analysts had expected despite strong revenue growth, reflecting a record $10.3 billion in capital and exploration expenditures.
lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Exxon Mobil and Royal Dutch Shell reported large increases in second-quarter profits on Thursday, benefiting from oil and gasoline prices that have been propelled upward by political turbulence in the Middle East and North Africa.

headline.main: Higher Prices Buoy Profits as Oil Companies Scramble for New Fields
headline.print_headline: Higher Prices Buoy Profits as Oil Companies Scramble for New Fields
